info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 6:03AM PST until December 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY... * CHANGES...Slight increase in snow amounts, and updated information in impacts segment. * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches...except 5 to 10 inches above 5000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph through this afternoon. * WHERE...Surprise Valley California and Northern Washoe County. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will become slick and hazardous for this evening`s commute, continuing into Tuesday morning. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Even lighter snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
